tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The last Question Time for the parliamentary year. Coverage from the Senate. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Josh Byrne meets a team of young urban gardeners, Jane Edmanson explores an inner-city courtyard, Tino Carnevale builds a range of supports for summer vegetables and Millie Ross converts a container for alpine plants.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Forsytes
programme.desc: After a family night at the opera, Jolyon makes a life-changing discovery, whilst Soames, smitten by Irene, makes a hasty marriage proposal.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Psychologist Paul North has employed his son Josh to take on the task of building a bullet proof earth berm house, deep in New South Wales Yass Valley, to protect them from bushfires and the extremes of climate change.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Maigret grapples with his failure and tries to understand the man whom he failed to protect.

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Myf and Alan take the show by the horns, literally! Theyre joined by the grudge-holding MC Suffa, Jem Cassar-Daley, Peter Helliar and Denise Scott. Spiderbait close with a ramming and jamming performance of Black Betty.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Lyell team are called back to the tunnel as another victim is targeted.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Maigret grapples with his failure and tries to understand the man whom he failed to protect.

programme.title: When The War Is Over
programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths follows in the footsteps of director Peter Weir to understand how his 1981 blockbuster film unintentionally brought an ailing Anzac legend roaring back to life.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A hit and run and a stabbing death in a remote Northumberland valley have DCI Vera Stanhope and her team investigating the connection between the two people involved.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Kerbal Space Program 2 and Easter Eggs In Games!
programme.desc: This week, Gem takes on a mission to the Mun in the new Kerbal Space Program 2, and tells us her fave video game easter egg. Plus, Dr Deviser tests some gamer brains!

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Buttercup takes her game winning mini golf ball, in spite of ominous warnings of dire consequences.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a pong or two in the lab as the Doctors discover how your sense of smell can bring back happy memories.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Very Lost Notebook
programme.desc: When Maudie loses her beloved notebook Ezra, Ava and Kyle band together to reunite their friend with her most prized possession.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi must free a wild creature captured by Taborr.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and his chums awake to find the farm covered in snow!

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nash and the droids pursue a stolen ship part.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This fourth heat is an explosive display of spinners, as old favourites take on new hopefuls. Competing for a place in the heat final are Supernova, Frostbite, Wyrm, High 5, Crushtacean, Ironside 3, Pulsar and Apex.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: This is water skiing with a difference - towed by a rowing team, will Charlotte stay standing for the fastest 100m record?

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: The Earth Explodes?! A Decisive Kamehameha!
programme.desc: With Goku badly injured, Vegeta steps in to face Frieza. Stronger than ever, Vegeta proves to be a challenge and an enraged Frieza destroys the planet! Protected by Whis, the Z fighters are given a chance to save Earth.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Buttercup steals Octi to teach Bubbles a lesson.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand has broken the rules and snuck a marble run into the lab but will Dr Chris notice in todays blood pressure experiment?!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Burgled Bags
programme.desc: When Gary, the schools lollipop man, is accused of stealing bags from parents cars, Kyle is devastated and determined to clear his name.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Inaya takes Nash for a ride in her new ship.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Pokemon, Cleopatra, Cats the Musical and Kath and Kim
programme.desc: Tom Gleeson is back with the Big Brass Mug and four young know-it-alls want to claim it as their own: a Pokemon expert, an aficionado on Cleopatra, a fan of the musical Cats, and a Kath and Kim connoisseur.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: The 6th Universes Destroyer! His Name Is Champa!
programme.desc: Vegeta and Goku are continuing their training under Whis when they receive a pair of visitors - Beerus brother and Whis sister! After a comparison of culinary delights, Champa challenges Beerus to a universe tournament.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Should Australia do more to stop ticket scalpers? We look at some of the safeguards already in place designed to stop scammers and inflated prices.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: The Stand Up Sketch Show
programme.desc: Breakneck comedy show packed with stand-up routines from top comics, brought to life in sketch form. Featuring Seann Walsh, Huge Davies, Sharon Wanjohi and Ian Smith.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Are you squeamish? Find out why in todays lab experiment and get ready to get moving in Investigation Ouch! The Doctors tackle medical mysteries on the wards in Ouch and About and we meet two more new Ouch Patients.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Into The Future Again Goku Blacks True Identity Revealed!
programme.desc: Beerus is convinced that his actions shouldve influenced the future, but Future Trunks isnt so sure! Now its time for Goku, Vegeta, and Future Trunks to see for themselves - and Bulma is going, too!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is very excited by his new purchase. He calls on Bitzer to set up his new TV while he readies himself to watch life in 3D. To his surprise, its more 3D than he could ever have imagined!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: The Wedding Witch Of Wainsly Hall!
programme.desc: Jeff Foxworthy needs the gangs help with a witch.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: When the box goes missing at a haunted mansion, the Bears play detective to help uncover the thief.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Lets head to the beach and learn how to count in fours with Numberblock Four to Forty.

programme.title: Lets Sing!
programme.desc: Justine Clarke sings Its Oh So Quiet.

programme.title: Your Paintings
programme.desc: A statue comes to life in a magical gallery and climbs into the painting Van Goghs Chair by Vincent Van Gogh. Inside the painting she explores Van Goghs use of colour and light to express feelings.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Learn about street art, famous street artists and creating a name tag.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: We speak to one of the teens challenging Australias upcoming social media age ban in the High Court.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels up to Queensbury Yorkshire to help retired teacher Mary, whose country cottage has lost its charm. Widowed and with her children having flown the nest, the house has become too big and expensive for Mary to keep.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: The MythBusters call in the help of the FBI as they investigate an explosive trouser tall tale and, Adam and Jamie then try to save viewers some hard-earned cash in The Great Gas Conspiracy.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Secret Agent Phil travels to Braunstone Town, Leicester to a tired and tatty semi thats failing to attract a buyer. Mum Pauline and daughter Rebecca are desperate to sell up to ease the financial strain.

programme.title: The Craft
programme.desc: Four high school misfits who experiment with witchcraft must deal with the consequences of their newfound abilities.

programme.title: rage Vault Guest Programmer: The Avalanches
programme.desc: Marking 25 years since the release of The Avalanches legendary debut album Since I Left You, rage replays their 2000 guest program.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: When a seemingly simple kidnapping ends in murder, DI Neville Parker and the team must work out what went wrong and how someone ended up dead.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand goes underwater to show how your blood clots, and Dr Ronx finds out how echolocation - an amazing navigation technique used by bats to fly in the dark - is helping visually impaired patients.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Zamasus Ambition - The Storied project 0 Mortals Of Terror
programme.desc: The future is unchanged, Black isnt what Goku had initially thought, and the situation has escalated to something more severe. With this new information, will the Saiyan trio fare better than before?

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: The Series
programme.desc: Mavis has promised to spend the day in the spa with Wendy and have lunch with the werewolf twins at the same time. If only she could teleport between them.

programme.title: Lagging
programme.desc: Sol, Mo and Leah are at the Respawn Point recruiting for a Team to play tonights Zaag Rumble. Theyre two players down on Team SMoRCLe with best-friend duo Ray and Cedric on holiday in Lithuania.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Surrey helping recently retired couple Lenny and Mary who want to sell up and return to Ireland. But until they sell their home of 37 years, their dream cottage by the sea remains just that - a dream.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: The Pontipines decide to have their dinner on the Ninky Nonk.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Squidgie wants to take photos of all her friends to hang on the walls of Mimis cafe. So she borrows Ziggys camera, but taking photos isnt easy.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel meets a new friend, Max, who is autistic. Daniel learns what he can do when Max needs more time to get comfortable and more space to play in his own way.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: At Ammas creche the children make eggy heads with egg shells and cress seeds. Bing knows his Eggy needs water, light and time before it can grow hair but waiting is hard so he tries to speed up the process.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny Pig shows Peppa and George her chickens, whilst something has been eating Grandpa Pigs lettuces.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer, Shaun and Flock are convinced that a monster is at loose on the farm and hide in the barn. But what exactly is it they are afraid of?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Out looking for Gaston, after banning him from the castle, the elves and fairies come across a speaking door which leads to the dwarf mine. Once in, they find they cant get out. Who will save them?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny Sheep and Suzy take Granny Pig and Peppa around Art House Day. After a day full of screen printing and silhouette miniatures, Granny Pig finds the perfect art piece at Suzys house.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When an egg cracks to reveal a baby Avocadodon, Ginger and the Pea-Rexes have to find a fun way to lead the energetic baby back to its herd.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When Shellington gets lost in a dark sea cave, he gets unexpected assistance from some blind Remipedes.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Its bedtime and Rosa is about to read the story The Prince Who Saved the Princess which Tish is not happy about.

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Zindzi and Teo meet Reem, a volunteer for Australian Red Cross! We learn about donating at a fundraising stall, before Teo and Zindzi put on a concert for the toys! Through The Windows, we see more volunteers in an animation.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew have to come up with a way to deliver Ms. Kashanis very popular homemade Roti on time and save the school fundraising campaign!

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Grown-Up Jobs
programme.desc: When Jay hears about Appas big day at the allotment doing grown-up jobs, he decides he wants to be a grown-up too. Nikhil helps him be just like the other grown-ups in the house.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Trying broccoli as a new food can be challenging. Eddie learns how to overcome this by seeing, smelling, touching and finally - trying.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Amy has so many jobs to do around the house that she doesnt have any time to go out and play. The Bananas are sad - they love to play with their friends and its not nearly as much fun if one of them cant join in anymore.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come and learn all about families, big and small, and meet The Wiggles loved ones! With groovy moves and catchy tunes like Double Happy - The Twins Song - its a singing and dancing celebration for the whole family!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Percy has been hiding an oil leak, afraid of what it means to get it fixed. When it starts to interfere with his deliveries, Percy needs Thomas and his other friends to help him figure out what to do.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When Tiddles the Tortoise gets stuck in a tree, Pedro Pony has trouble trying to rescue him!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: The baby Pea-Rexes love to slide down the necks of giant Broccolisaurus, except for Split who is terrified and has to learn to overcome his fears.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Its the Twins birthdays and the Dream Factory Crew is determined to surprise Drew and Jonathan with their own special gifts - but can they keep the secret from both brothers at the same time?!

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts study a group of baby hammerhead sharks, as they hunt on their own for the first time and poke their noses into trouble.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its the Carrot Solstice and the Squirrels need to protect the carrots from impatient visitors.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is asked to help at the animal park for the day and realises theres more to the job than he first thought.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and Zsofi plant a colourful edible flower garden, perfect for a yummy garden tea party.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join Tsehay and Captain Featherword as they explore the dress-up box- what till they find?! Enjoy the colourful animated version of Wheels on the Bus, then get ready to Do the Propeller.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mr Potato has come to visit the playgroup and hes brought along his superhero friend, Super Potato!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard accidentally deletes some of Dads "boring" Proximan sound recordings. Through a dramatic sound-adventure Cosima realises his recordings are not boring: theyre Cosmic!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its the day of the big Kangaroo Beach beach cricket match, but when Gemma and the cadets find a nest of turtle eggs, they play parents, vowing to protect the eggs from seagulls, crabs and flying cricket balls.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.sub-title: The Power Of Mystery Mountain Part 2
programme.desc: The story continues, after Mystery Mountain breaks out of its dimension and floats over the city.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Whose story will earn them a camp fire story telling badge and will any of them be too scary!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly and Ben think Gaston the Ladybird is sad so they try and cheer him up by tidying his cave. But Gaston liked his cave just as it was all messy and untidy. Ben and Holly cheer Gaston up by making his cave all messy again.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the kids build a frog bog from an upcycled sink with hidey holes for the frogs and surround it with plants. We check back to see if the frogs come.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: A mysterious jet of water, a tiddle, appears suddenly next to Igglepiggle.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop cant sleep because hes lost his favourite teddy bear, Spanna. Everyone decides to help find Spanna, so Bop can get a good nights sleep.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: A New Friend At The Clock Factory
programme.desc: Daniel is at Chime Time with his new friend, Max. When Max is overwhelmed by the bright lights and loud sounds, Daniel and his friends learn what they can do to help make a calmer Chime Time so Max can play, too.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing gets jealous when Sula pays more attention to Pando on a playdate. As he feels more and more left out Bing tries to get Sulas attention and spoils Sulas tea party.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is Talent Day at Peppas playgroup, and Madame Gazelle wants everyone to show the class their special talent.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When Timmy sees a particularly grumpy farmer giving one of the flock a hard time, he decides to give him an idea of what its like to be a sheep.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: When Isadoras cousins, Mirabelle and Wilbur try outdoing each other with magic it scares away their pet dragon, Violet in an unfamiliar part of the forest.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Indy and Rusty play Mums and Dads, they cant agree on who should go to work, so they part company. Indy has a hard time finding a babysitter, while Bluey makes Rusty her baby.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Silver Paw plots to steal the kids homemade biscuits before they serve them to Nana. When Squash becomes distracted by the yummy dough, hes turned into a gingerbread man!

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds ride a sailboat! They feel the wind fill the sails, watch a sailor prep, and learn boat parts like hull, keel, rudder, and wheel that help steer and keep the boat steady.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: Ranger Nat is hiking and finds the Big-Footed Cave Bird. The Mechas realize it cant get back into her home.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes: Return To Planet Gloop
programme.desc: Defeated time and time again, Gloop the Third accepts help from an unlikely ally - Romeo!

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: Maddie + Triggs are baking a cake for Granny, but when the recipe goes missing they are forced to mix it up and add some surprising new ingredients that are quite simply bonkers!

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Rio has lost his air guitar - disaster! The band travel to Planet Rock to get it back.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mr Potato has come to visit the playgroup and hes brought along his superhero friend, Super Potato!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard wants to have a go with Dads new drone but first he has to prove that he can go a whole day without breaking something precious. Good luck Big Lizard!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew are preparing to earn their Neighbourhood Helper badge when Jonathan takes a tumble and has to use a wheelchair for a few days.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts are exploring Antarctica, when Shellington discovers strange microscopic creatures living under the ice.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas finds out that the Earls Technology Fair will bring new inventions to Sodor, he sets out to prove that steam engines are the best inventions ever.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie realizes she could use another maker space at Dads house, she and Dad set out to build their very own treehouse.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and Marcus build a Birds Nest Shop for all the local birds to visit and take what they need for their birds nests.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa gets her very first Playgroup Star in school for drawing a wonderful picture of her house!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of Jeremy Fishers Musical Adventure
programme.desc: When Jeremy Fisher gets into trouble while composing a new piece, only Peter and his friends can save him!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dad shows the kids how to use their old baby-harness, a new game is born: Dad Baby! But Dad is unprepared for the harsh realities of giving birth to a baby Bingo.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The circus has come to town and the Squirrels are very excited until they see its a flea circus. Its so tiny! It doesnt seem very impressive until they get to see some of the acts like Fifi and her daring tightrope act!

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Flutter helps Brinicle with his brioche baking leaving the Piris with a massive problem.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The last Question Time for the parliamentary year. Coverage from the Senate. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A tasty sampler of stories from the land - covering food, agriculture, crops, climate, business and innovation - as we meet the fascinating people who make our rural and regional communities unique. Presented by Pip Courtney.

David Speers presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and businesses big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry.

David Speers presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: A tasty sampler of stories from the land - covering food, agriculture, crops, climate, business and innovation - as we meet the fascinating people who make our rural and regional communities unique. Presented by Pip Courtney.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Olivia Caisley asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: When you need to know whats going on across the country and around the globe, turn to Lorna Dunkley for a comprehensive roundup of the days news plus original reporting on the issues that affect you.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Manny Tsigas brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: The latest official figures on the economy show inflation re-emerging as a major economic problem. Annual inflation rose to 3.8% in October, according to new monthly data released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Catherine Murphy and the team hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus regulars including film critic Zak Hepburn and our resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Chas and John cover the "terror" shooting of two National Guard members in Washington DC and the latest on the Ukraine peace deal. Plus the dismissals of cases against James Comey and Letitia James. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: The latest official figures on the economy show inflation re-emerging as a major economic problem. Annual inflation rose to 3.8% in October, according to new monthly data released by the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: Designer babies with selected gender: A booming market in Northern Cyprus. Plus Boostedt, ten years after the refugee influx - integration marked by progress and conflict.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: A fake mosque proposal duped the media, exposing how little fact-checking was done. Satirical news site The Betoota Advocate laugh all the way to the bank with cheeky sponsored content. Thanks to eagle-eyed tipsters. (Final)

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Catherine Murphy and the team hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus regulars including film critic Zak Hepburn and our resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky.

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.sub-title: 1982 - Border and Thompsons almost miracle at the MCG
programme.desc: Legendary commentator Jim Maxwell counts down his top six Ashes moments from his more than 50-year career. In third spot, he and Corbin Middlemas revel in Allan Border and Jeff Thompsons almost miracle at the MCG in 1982.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.
